sub_title: Passie voor (master)data! - Zonder hoge (master)data kwaliteit geen waarde uit die data.
summary:
24 years of experience in a Global Organization (McCain Foods) servicing the operational business units with IT support in the broadest context for the first 15 years. And after that, worked on Master Data Governance and Management processes. And now joining a global Data & Analytics team in our journey to become a more 'data driven' company.

I managed to build long term relationships in a challenging environment were business colleagues expecting IT solutions in a company structure were IT solution development/sourcing is managed by a Global IT team located in Canada (Florenceville) needing to deliver in to business units 'around the world'. Managing expectations from business colleagues and making sure there needs are well heard and responded to by the overall IT group requires a wide range of skills (hard and soft). In this role I've been exposed to many different business processes and learned a lot about how McCain is operating. 

And after our global SAP implementation in 2013, I shifted focus from IT systems towards Master Data Goverance/Management as it became clear that without quality master data, automation of business processes and ability to easily gain insights about those processes is a challenge. Not even speaking about using the data for more advanced type of Analytics.

I had the opportunity to travel the world as part of the McCain family and I am grateful for that. It been tough sometimes but I wouldn't have missed it.

In september 2022 I've joined the ZorgSaam Group. A new environment with a hospital and centers for elderly care and home care teams. The challenge of closing the gap, or at least not let it further grow, between the need for care in a quickly aging population and the capacity to keep up with that need using new (data) technology is huge. There's a lot to gain and the organization has made digitalization to support the care processes one of the priorities. I am pleased to be part of the team driving the change.

Competences: People Manager and Team Builder. Honest, open, straight forward and finding ways to get things done. Strong soft skills resulting in fast (working)relationship building and sustaining those. And with 'a passion for data'. Service oriented.

Deze periode van orienteren heeft me uiteindelijk bij zorggroep ZorgSaam in Terneuzen gebracht. Daar wacht de enorme uitdaging om m.b.t. van (data) technologie de zorgprocessen te optimaliseren en daarmee aan de toenemende zorgvraag te kunnen blijven voldoen.

profile_positions.location: Emerging Markets (UAE, India, China, Japan, Taiwan, Mexico)
profile_positions.description:
In March 2009 I accepted the challenge to become IT-Manager McCain International & Emerging Markets. McCain International is the business unit within McCain that is entering new markets and arranges all sales to the countries where we don’t have factories i.e. Mexico, Japan, Carribean, Central America and Middle East. McCain International is sourcing it’s products as a customer of companies like McCain USA, McCain Canada, McCain Continental Europe, etc. There are offices in Canada, Mexico City, Dubai and Singapore. In the smaller sales regions like Carribean, sales people are working from home offices.

Business Unit Emerging markets holds offices India (New Delhi), China (Harbin, Shanghai), Taiwan (Taipei and Fengshan) and South-East Asia (Singapore) with factories in Meshana (India), Harbin (China). Also here we have sales people working from home offices in some other countries in the region (Phillipines, Indonesia, Korea).

As part of this job I started with a team of 2 persons (1 Business Analyst and 1 PC Technician) in China (Harbin) and 1 person in Florenceville (PC Technician). During the first year I hired 1 Business Analyst in New Delhi, 1 Business Analysist in Shanghai (both re-located from our Global Technology Center in Florenceville) and 1 Business Analysit for the business unit of McCain International (also a person that worked at our the Global Technology Center).

Main activities in this role are to implent ‘IT account management’ for the 2 business units, implement IT Governance structures, setup a well performing IT team by involving them in the Global IT initiatives and, in general terms, make sure the business units get the IT support they deserve.

Together with that I was responsible for all IT solutions used within the Sales & Marketing departments in the whole region (incl. the production companies in Holland, Belgium, France and Poland).
